alert.note: Alert for Lyon; Morris; Osage; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 3:29PM CDT until May 09 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CDT FOR EASTERN MORRIS...WESTERN SHAWNEE...WABAUNSEE...NORTHWESTERN OSAGE...SOUTHEASTERN POTTAWATOMIE AND LYON COUNTIES... At 328 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Emmett to near Auburn to 5 miles east of Cottonwood Falls, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Emporia, Wamego, Osage City, Council Grove, Carbondale, Rossville, Alma, Eskridge, St. Marys, Dover, Auburn, Burlingame, Americus, Scranton, St. George, Maple Hill, Alta Vista, McFarland, Harveyville and Reading. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 128 and 137. Interstate 70 between mile markers 323 and 352. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 117 and 173. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Lyon; Morris; Osage; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
